t: Proverbs 4
Get Wisdom at Any Cost
Listen,*pn my sons, to a father’s instruction; pay*ld attention and gain understanding.
I*ln give you sound learning, so*ld do not forsake my teaching.
For*ln I too was a son to my father, still*ld tender, and cherished by my mother.
Then*ln he taught me, and he said to me, “Take*ld hold of my words with all your heart; keep*ld my commands, and you will live.
Get*ln wisdom, get understanding; do*ld not forget my words or turn away from them.
Do*ln not forsake wisdom, and she will protect you; love*ld her, and she will watch over you.
The*ln beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom. Though*ld it cost all you have, get understanding.
Cherish*ln her, and she will exalt you; embrace*ld her, and she will honor you.
She*ln will give you a garland to grace your head and*ld present you with a glorious crown.”
Listen,*pn my son, accept what I say, and*ld the years of your life will be many.
I*ln instruct you in the way of wisdom and*ld lead you along straight paths.
When*ln you walk, your steps will not be hampered; when*ld you run, you will not stumble.
Hold*ln on to instruction, do not let it go; guard*ld it well, for it is your life.
Do*ln not set foot on the path of the wicked or*ld walk in the way of evildoers.
Avoid*ln it, do not travel on it; turn*ld from it and go on your way.
For*ln they cannot rest until they do evil; they*ld are robbed of sleep till they make someone stumble.
They*ln eat the bread of wickedness and*ld drink the wine of violence.
The*pn path of the righteous is like the morning sun, shining*ld ever brighter till the full light of day.
But*ln the way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they*ld do not know what makes them stumble.
My*pn son, pay attention to what I say; turn*ld your ear to my words.
Do*ln not let them out of your sight, keep*ld them within your heart;
for*ln they are life to those who find them and*ld health to one’s whole body.
Above*ln all else, guard your heart, for*ld everything you do flows from it.
Keep*ln your mouth free of perversity; keep*ld corrupt talk far from your lips.
Let*ln your eyes look straight ahead; fix*ld your gaze directly before you.
Give*ln careful thought to the paths for your feet and*ld be steadfast in all your ways.
Do*ln not turn to the right or the left; keep*ld your foot from evil.
